display.name: Polygon PoS

reasonsForBeingOther.label: No proofs
reasonsForBeingOther.shortDescription: The proof system isn't fully functional
reasonsForBeingOther.description: Projects without a proper proof system fully rely on single entities to safely update the state. A malicious proposer can finalize an invalid state, which can cause loss of funds.

display.description: Polygon PoS is an EVM-compatible, proof of stake sidechain for Ethereum, planning to become a Validium with a state validating bridge. The bridge is currently validated by Polygon validators and allows for asset as well as data movement between Polygon and Ethereum.

layer.description: The data is guaranteed to be available by Polygon proof of stake validators. On Ethereum, the data is indirectly referenced in the signed block header.

bridge.description: The bridge verifies that at least 2/3+1 of the Polygon PoS stake has signed off on the checkpoint. The StakeManager contract is the source of truth for the current validator set.

stateValidation.description: Currently the system permits invalid state roots. More details in project overview.

dataAvailability.description: Data is guaranteed to be available by an external proof of stake network of validators. On Ethereum, DA is attested via signed block headers.

exitWindow.description: There is no window for users to exit in case of an unwanted regular upgrade since contracts are instantly upgradable.

sequencerFailure.description: Users can submit transactions to an L1 queue, but can't force them. The sequencers cannot selectively skip transactions but can stop processing the queue entirely. In other words, if the sequencers censor or are down, they are so for everyone. In Polygon PoS, the sequencers network corresponds to the PoS validators network, which is composed of 104 members.

proposerFailure.description: The Polygon PoS network is composed of 104 validators. Blocks are included in the chain only if signed by 2/3+1 of the network stake. It's currently not possible to join the set if the validator cap is reached. The current validator cap is set to 105. In the event of a failure in reaching consensus, withdrawals are frozen.

stateCorrectness.name: No state validation
stateCorrectness.description: State updates are settled on Ethereum if signed by at least 2/3+1 of the Polygon PoS validators stake. Contracts on Ethereum do not check whether the state transitions are valid.

risks.text: validators on Polygon decide to not mint tokens after observing an event on Ethereum.
validators decide to mint more tokens than there are locked on Ethereum thus preventing some existing holders from being able to bring their funds back to Ethereum.
validators submit a fraudulent checkpoint allowing themselves to withdraw all locked funds.

otherConsiderations.name: Destination tokens are upgradeable
otherConsiderations.description: Tokens transferred end up as wrapped ERC20 proxies, some of them are upgradable. The contract is named UChildERC20Proxy.

risks.text: destination token contract is maliciously upgraded.

addresses.name: RootChain
addresses.description: Contract storing Polygon PoS chain checkpoints. Note that validity of these checkpoints is not verified, it is assumed to be valid if signed by 2/3 of the Polygon Validators.

addresses.name: StateSender
addresses.description: Smart contract allowing whitelisted addresses to send messages to contracts on Polygon PoS chain.

addresses.name: RootChainManager
addresses.description: Main configuration contract to manage tokens, token types, escrows (predicates) for given token types.          It also serves as an entry point for deposits and withdrawals effectively acting as a token router.

addresses.name: StakeManager
addresses.description: Main configuration contract to manage stakers and their voting power and validate checkpoint signatures.

addresses.name: StakingInfo
addresses.description: Contains logging and getter functions about staking on Polygon.

addresses.name: Registry
addresses.description: Maintains the addresses of the contracts used in the system.

addresses.name: DepositManager
addresses.description: Contract to deposit and escrow ETH, ERC20 or ERC721 tokens. Currently only used for POL.

addresses.name: WithdrawManager
addresses.description: Contract handling users' withdrawal finalization for tokens escrowed in DepositManager.

addresses.name: ERC20PredicateBurnOnly
addresses.description: Contract used to initiate ERC20 token withdrawals. The function to handle Plasma proofs is empty, meaning exits cannot be challenged.

addresses.name: ERC721PredicateBurnOnly
addresses.description: Contract used to initiate ERC721 token withdrawals. The function to handle Plasma proofs is empty, meaning exits cannot be challenged.

addresses.name: EventsHub
addresses.description: Contains events used by other contracts in the system.

addresses.name: ExitNFT
addresses.description: NFTs used to represent a withdrawal in the withdrawal PriorityQueue (Only used for tokens initially deposited via DepositManager).

addresses.name: Timelock
addresses.description: Contract enforcing delay on code upgrades. The current delay is 0s.

risks.text: a contract receives a malicious code upgrade. There is no delay on code upgrades.

permissions.name: PolygonMultisig
permissions.description: A Gnosis Safe with 5 / 9 threshold.  Can propose and execute code upgrades.
